intro: Gagea sylvatica f. cracoviensis, commonly known as the Cracow form of the woodland gagea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asparagaceae family. It is a bulbous perennial that produces delicate, grass-like leaves and small, fragrant white or pale blue flowers. This subspecies is native to Central and Eastern Europe, particularly in forested regions of Poland and surrounding areas. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and valuable component of its native ecosystems.
